derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English templ, tempel, reinforced in Middle English by Old French temple, both from Latin templum 'open or consecrated space'
Middle English: from Old French, from an alteration of Latin tempora, plural of tempus 'temple of the head'
late Middle English: from Old French, perhaps ultimately the same word as temple

entry.tran: (尤指佛教、印度教以及古希腊、古罗马时代的)寺院，庙宇，圣殿
entry.def: A temple is a building used for the worship of a god or gods, especially in the Buddhist and Hindu religions, and in ancient Greek and Roman times.
Your temples are the flat parts on each side of the front part of your head, near your forehead.

example.ex: Threads of silver ran through his beard and the hair at his temples.
example.tran: 他的胡须和鬓发里夹杂着缕缕银丝。

means.word_mean: 1. place of worship consisting of an edifice for the worship of a deity
2. the flat area on either side of the forehead;
3. an edifice devoted to special or exalted purposes
4. (Judaism) the place of worship for a Jewish congregation
